answers.answer: What a precious picture!!!  I am so dying to get another 3d ultrasound (the first hardly counts since it was at 16 weeks and babe looked like Skeletor at the time)...hubby isn't keen on spending the extra cash though since Mason will be debuting sometime in the next 10 weeks :)  Awesome picture though, handsome little guy.
thanks it took me 2 times to get a decent pic and i thought if i don't get one this time i'm just going to take what ever..

Hi everybody,I want a 3d u/s but my doctor advice me not to spend those extra $200 because he thinks is a scan?..(lol) and we are so close to May he will be here soon...I am in disability since I can not walk as much as before , the baby is big and sitting in the bottom of my belly ( looks very comfy) so it makes pressure in my pelvic  but I am ok as long i dont walk to much.I sleep almost sitting down ad on my living room "comfy" couch... i dont feel comfy in my bed.it seems i will have a c- section.....

question: i'm going great the only exception is that Blayde is in breech position and keeps kicking me in the bladder so before i actually go to sleep have to go to the toilet 100 times, also that i have gestational diabetes and trying to keep my levels regular is being a bit of a challenge but getting there i think.. on the upside instead of putting on weight i seems to be losing it due to having to watch what i eat, and also what do you guys think of having babies turned around if they are breech position as if he doesn't want to turn by himself i would like preferably not to have a c section and i see this is my only option.
title: it's been a bit quite around here.... how is everyone going seen as we all have the end in sight
